website_summaries.verdict: A minimalist trail shoe with a rugged and ultra-grippy outsole.
pros: A low-to-the-ground construction offers trails runners stability and ground-feel
The Vibram sole delivers outstanding traction in a durable package
Upper stretches for a comfortable fit
cons: Multiple users cited sizing issues, with many needing to size up

customer_reviews.title: Buy at least 1/2 size up! A lot of people will need the wide. You owe it to yourself to at least try and fit into these shoes.
customer_reviews.text: If you haven't figured it out yet these run small. I wear a 13 and had to go with a 14 2E. Big Feet don't have access to half sizes but a 13.5 may have worked. I use these for hiking and I have never experienced a shoe this comfortable. The toe box on the wide is wonderfully big and the mesh on top is so soft that I forget I'm wearing shoes at times. The picture of the Tornado/Orange is deceiving as it is more of a blue-green color than the blue that shows up on my screen.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hileman

customer_reviews.title: 2E is like a narrow D
customer_reviews.text: The 9.5 "2E" is more like a narrow D width. After 15 minutes of wear I realized I had to return them Too bad, because they are amazingly light and look fantastic. What were the New Balance designers thinking??
customer_reviews.author: ExRxIT

customer_reviews.title: Returned Them Due To The Strap On The Forefoot
customer_reviews.text: I'm normally a 13 M, but based on the reviews, I bought 14 EE, and they were a good fit, although slightly loose in the heel. Unfortunately, the strap over the forefoot ruined the shoe for me so I sent them back without ever running in them. I could feel it rubbing on the outside of my little toes, and also slightly on the top of my foot. I'll stick with my Trail Gloves, which are my favorite shoes for running. I had bought these because of the 4mm drop to give my achilles a break once in a while, but the strap is a deal breaker for me. Good lucking shoes, and seemed well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: They give me a little more support and impact cushioning than the vibram 5 fingers that I had been wearing. Running store tried to get me to run in a 10 cm lift shoe for more support but it hurt so bad after only a quarter mile. These are only a 4 cm lift or something like that and I was able to transition from the 5 fingers in only 1 or 2 runs
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Minimal, so size is paramount
customer_reviews.text: I had the original versions when that first came out, the MT10. I bought several pairs which I religiously wore and ran into the ground. For the present 10v1, I already have a yellow and black 12.5 pair. Fits like a glove. I purchased a second pair, orange and blue, but for some reason the right shoe is slightly more snug that i remember the first pair being. I attributed it to needing to be broken in. I'm still working on that but it's taking longer than with the recent pair I already own. Perhaps for this color, a half size larger would be better or this particular shoe was divergent from the mold.
customer_reviews.author: Awesome_0

customer_reviews.title: Cured my foot pain!
customer_reviews.text: At 63 yrs. old, I had a year long peroneal tendon issue that I thought had become chronic. I had tried everything including PT, exercises, rest, lots of ice and anti- inflammatories... I bought these thinking they'd be comfortable around my house and a light exercise shoe to pack on trips. Incredibly, within a month of wearing them religiously...in the house, outside doing ranch chores and on walks on and off pavement, the foot pain ceased. Now I've bought another pair in a different color. I'm forever grateful!
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Looks & roomy toe box saved you from a one star rating
customer_reviews.text: They look nice, the toe box is roomy, and the heel seems to have enough cushion for short to medium trail runs...but... This is the second pair with the first pair being the standard and now this pair being the 2E they are still far too narrow across the bridge of my feet. I normally wear the and have gone through numerous pairs of 20v2, v3, v4, v5, which have all fit very comfortably for weight lifting (maybe the reason for wide feet I guess) even at standard with but these must have been designed by Darby O'Gill & the little people...Back to the drawing board with these for you New Balance. Sending them back now!
customer_reviews.author: Phil Shultz Landscapes

customer_reviews.title: Super light but 1st pair of NB in a 2E that was a little too tight
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in hopes of having a good shoe for Spartan and Terrain races. I like the look and they are crazy light, weight-wise. Wish they had a more aggressive tread for what I'm using them for but they're okay. Returned a pair of Inov-8 trail shoes that were too tight and these aren't all that much better honestly. I have a wide foot which limits shoes I can comfortably wear so I frequently purchase New Balance since usually available in 2E at stores. They are always comfortable but slightly disappointed this time
customer_reviews.author: JRH

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable AND CUTE. I always receive compliments.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE these shoes! They're comfortable, cute, easy to throw on in a hurry, and I get a TON of compliments on them. Keep in mind I DON'T exercise, run or anything of the sort, so I can't comment on their reliability for such, but these are GREAT day to day shoes when you just wanna get out of the house and be comfortable. I've walked mega distances around airports in them, worn them to theme parks, and they still hold up and look great just as they did when I received them. If you're debating on it, ORDER THEM!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Not a runner but a driver.
customer_reviews.text: So, I used to run, but shin splints took me out of that a long time ago. No I bought these for driving (and general use since I prefer bare feet). These are great, wide toe box, minimal bulk (fit nicely between all three pedals), super light and flexible (oh and low key looking). My only concern is if the mesh will hold up over time. Great driving shoe.
customer_reviews.author: F Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow
customer_reviews.text: I read everyone’s reviews and ordered a half size up. Unfortunately, the shoes are exceptionally narrow, especially given that I ordered 2E, and hurt my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are amazing! Normally I run in my vibram five finger ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing! Normally I run in my vibram five finger shoes but I wanted something that would allow me to wear socks in the wet/cold PNW winter. These shoes still give me the minimist feel I like and the added comfort of socks. The thicker sole makes them great for trail running.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Lynott

customer_reviews.title: Not like the original !
customer_reviews.text: The toe box is more restrictive and the tread is less flexible. I’ve owned three of the original and still use one of the three that dates back two years ( I barefoot whenever it’s at all feasible ). The new one is not the same. 😔 It is still a good shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Crayonization

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome and so light weight
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome and so light weight. The fit is borderline. I wear 101/2 and ordered these in 10 1/2 but they are a tad small, but then again, for the gym, or light hiking, the snug fit is amazing. They are very comfortable. I might lean more towards going a half a size bigger if your just wearing these for every day wear just for additional comfort, but really... no complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Shoes Ever
customer_reviews.text: I have run in the minimus for years and absolutely love them. The latest update made them less minimal, which I didn't like as much. It is so nice to see the old model back and to be back running in them. These are comfortable with great ground feel. I run about 50 to 60 miles a week, and about half of that is on rough trails. I find these work wonderfully on both trails and paved roads.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best sneakers I've worn
customer_reviews.text: Think I'll get 10 pairs of these and be set for life :) Seriously, the best sneakers I've had since I can remember. I have wide feet which these fit like a glove the fact that they look sharp and slick is an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Great fit.  No additional space for gel inserts.
customer_reviews.text: There is not room inside these, to add gel inserts, and even though they fit great, you also feel every rock that you step on. My feet sometimes get sore before my run is over, with these. I would still suggest a normal pair of thick soled running shoes, to alternate between. I still enjoy how well these fit, even though it sounds like a lot of complaining. Hopefully I will get more accustomed to them, as I get use the additional sensitivity, from not having the thick soles.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Not sized the way other New Balance shoes are...
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe, but the fit is off. I have been wearing New Balance for 20 years, but these are not sized the same as their running or cross training shoes. There is an elastic band running across the top of the mid foot that will cut off the circulation to your toes unless you have an exceptionally narrow foot....
customer_reviews.author: Gregory F. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Made well but sizing is too narrow and short. ...
customer_reviews.text: Made well but sizing is too narrow and short. I received what I ordered 9 2EE and they were too narrow and just a bit short for that stated size. 2EE is supposed to be extra wide! I am used to wearing 8.5 wide.
customer_reviews.author: Diego S. Terres III

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the minimalist or an alternative for a barefoot runner.
customer_reviews.text: At first I was concerned about the band over the foot, but was not a problem at all, the shoe fits perfectly. I marked this down one point because I noted some redness (no bruising or chafing) on top of my foot after a 6 mile run. The mesh material between the first shoestring eyelet and top of foot is thin and allows the shoestring to put pressure on the foot. The shoe is very light and I soon forget that I have shoes on at all.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Dare

customer_reviews.title: Super light.
customer_reviews.text: I like this shoe because its super light for my gym workout routine, I am not a trail runner so I can not rate it to that effect however, the shoe is designed to withstand more impact than other light trail running shoes. Good design, Just started using them so lets see how good the quality will be, only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Juan E. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: These are the perfect running shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect running shoes. I am on my second pair. My first pair lasted me 6 years and I expect this pair to last just as long. From this moment forth, I will always purchase a pair of New Balance Minimus when I am in the market for running shoes. I have also used these shoes for weight-training, cross fit, cycling, and jumping rope. They have never let me down, and for that New Balance has earned a life long customer!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: There was a hole
customer_reviews.text: This was the second pair I tried to order of these. This pair I received with a hole in the fabric. Really, a hole. A hundred dollars for trail running shoes that already had a hole. The first pair I ordered where too big. I really wanted to like these. Oh and by the way where I am located it took me almost a month each time to get the order. So to send them back and get new ones isn't even worth it. To bad!!
customer_reviews.author: shannon friesz

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow even though these were a half size larger than I really need
customer_reviews.text: These were a size 14 and I'm more of a 13.5 and they felt too snug across the forefoot as if too narrow but I don't normally where an extra wide shoe. These are definitely more minimal shoes as well meaning not much in terms of cushioning. All feet are different but these didn't fell comfortable to me.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They're great for running and just walking around. Since using minimal sole running shoes, I've started enjoying running again. I find that they run a tad small. Especially if you plan to wear socks. You can wear them without socks but it's more challenging to remove foot odor.
customer_reviews.author: DC Bill

customer_reviews.title: these are the best running shoes you can buy if you run on ...
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully the same workmanship went into this pair as my previous pair. So far, these are the best running shoes you can buy if you run on your toes. If you dont run on your toes then dont fret, they are still good. I had my old pair for 5 years, they have miles... lets hope these do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Piper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lightweight trail shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for trail hiking on the Appalachian Trail, these shoes are lightweight and comfortable and my feet felt snug in place while having nice airflow. The shoes did really well on wet and rough terrain, never had issues with grip. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: MTB maniac

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are nice. I got them for my fiancee because he loved his old pair so much. He says they are really comfortable but have to get used to the fit at first. The material is thin so I'm guessing they aren't going to last too long. Overall good shoe, but wish the price was a bit lower for the longevity of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Katie L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice minimalist shoe
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe that seems like it will be durable. Fit was fine and they are a bit resistant to wet while not sacrificing on the minimalist feel. Vibram soles were a seller! It's my second pair of NB Minimus and they look to be in for some hard living.
customer_reviews.author: LLWarrenP

customer_reviews.title: Read the reviews. This shoe will not fit you the first time. And if you wear a 13, it won’t fit ever.
customer_reviews.text: This would have been my third pair of this exact shoe and exact size (13) but it was too small this time. Most other reviews said the same. I should have believed them. Then the seller made me spend $30.00 to return them. Avoid this shoe and this seller. (ShoeMall)
customer_reviews.author: S. Buttrill

customer_reviews.title: Wide widths run narrow but they’re nice.
customer_reviews.text: These would be my favorite shoes ever if New Balance hadn’t started making the wide widths narrower. They used to be nice and wide and I can’t seem to find a new pair that’s close to the old ones. But, the minimal sole lets me have a more natural stride and keeps my knees happy.
customer_reviews.author: thebarzeen

customer_reviews.title: I liked the old version a little better
customer_reviews.text: I liked the old version a little better, but these are still good. The strap that goes over the top of your foot is now made of a rubber/stretchy material, used to be a less flexible thing. It was tight at first but has loosened up with wear.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes as expected!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes. Ive been wearing this name brand for about 5 years now and I absolutely love them! Great for trail running, walking, moving, shopping really anything. Ignore the negative reviews they dont know what they are talking about.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Gouin

customer_reviews.title: I bought it for my nephew who is not in ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my nephew who is not in this country. All the measurements were taken as instructed, and I also bought a size larger. Still, too small. I can't even return because it is out of the country now.
customer_reviews.author: J. Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Great sockless shoe for cross training, running and hiking
customer_reviews.text: These are designed to be a snug fit, and they are just that. They hug my feet which in turn gives you feeling they are part of your foot which was the intention of the design. Whether I'm running, cross training or hiking these are great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Meisch

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but a bit narrow for a wide size shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Very light and mostly comfortable. For wide shoes they are a bit snug in the front, so I don't think the sizes are exact. I have never had problems with fit before in New Balance shoes, but these do seem to run a bit small, or at least not as narrow as expected for a wide shoe. However, since they are one of the only companies making wide minimalist trail running shoes I can't complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Run Small
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit very small. I've had a couple pairs of these and had to size up a half size in order to be comfortable in this shoe. Unfortunately I forget that for this pair and ordered a pair that I was forced to wear before I could return them for the proper size.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Blessing

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is a little smaller than I thought
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair. I normally wear 9.5 to 10 with other shoes, and I bought 10 here. But I should have probably went up to 10.5. With thin socks or barefoot, they fit perfectly though.
customer_reviews.author: WhyoWhyoHolic

customer_reviews.title: narrow in the toe box
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes ! Working them into my running routine .Using these as a transition shoe that will hopefully allow me to move into a " zero drop " shoe . ! run with them every other day and I have also cut my distance in half on those days , so far so good ! I like the way they look too .
customer_reviews.author: Dave Carleton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. They are durable, very light, and the mesh allows them to breathe. I wear these all day, every day. Have had them for 8 months now, and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor stitching
customer_reviews.text: I like this style of shoe as they fit well and are very lightweight, but I would not buy this again because the stitching is terrible. The stitching along the tounge was already fraying when I took the shoes out of the box and came completely apart when I put the shoes on. Since the tounge of these shoes is a very thin piece of fabric, it is a mess with no stitching to hold the tounge in place.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Fahrenbruch

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Comfy and fairly durable. I've been wearing them all summer for runs, hikes, bike rides and more, and they've held up well. The threads are starting to fray above the toes now, but probably no more than any other sneaker would at this stage.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Not as wide as they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 2E and went up a half size and they are still way too narrow. I have an older version which fit great, it looks like they changed the cut. Sadly I missed the return window, but that's on me.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: I tried these and returned them because of the size ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried these and returned them because of the size so I can’t say much. My girlfriend has had these shoes for years so I wanted to give them a try. I’ve worn Merrell trail gloves in the past and needed new shoes. I’m not sure if this was just an error but these shoes were way way too small. I ordered a men’s 7 and these shoes are the exact size of my girlfriend’s women’s 7, if not a little more snug since hers aren’t broken in.
customer_reviews.author: Mydolly Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a size 1/2 larger than my usual size ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 1/2 larger than my usual size and 2E. I typically order regular width D. The width fit me, the length is a little too short and thus a seam in the back of the right shoe is hurting my heel. My feet are a little cramped. I would give 5 stars if it was not that for the size problem.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre B.

customer_reviews.title: still too narrow
customer_reviews.text: Even though I ordered a wide (which I normally don't even have to do with NB shoes), they are still too tight across the width. Also, the way the tongue is sewn in is awkward. I like them enough not to send them back, but wouldn't buy them again in light of these issues.
customer_reviews.author: JNS

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, lightweight but tight.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these I've bought. The first pair were two tight even though I bought 2E. I figured if I went a half size up they would fit better. Nope, still tight. Of well.
customer_reviews.author: Gordo Guapo

customer_reviews.title: Great for canyoneering and trail running
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, if you do ANY canyoneering or trail running, these are a MUST! not only do they feel like you aren't really wearing anything, they grip better than my bare feet. I was canyoneering n the Philippines with these over wet rocks and slippery stone... I NEVER lost footing. they drain super quick (Just watch out for sand...make sure you lace them up tight.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Johlic

customer_reviews.title: Fit Like a Glove
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new pair of minimalist New Balance shoes to replace an old pair. These were exactly what I was looking for, they fit snug, hug the foot and provide support. The old pair survived years of use and two Tough Mudders. Hope these fair the same....
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: After three years...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had New Balance Minimus for years and ordered the same size shoe as always. It was at least a half size too small if not a full size. Odd for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate sizing if no socks
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! Fits perfectly, but I don’t wear socks and would order half-size larger if you do. It is narrow, but I have narrow feet - otherwise consider wider size. The length is accurate and normal for the size 9 I ordered. Definitely “minimus”. Very light, and low to ground reducing ankle injuries. Sticky tread.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Extensions to my feet
customer_reviews.text: Been yearning to give these a try. First trail race completed and I have to admit it felt like I was floating through the woods. I love the feel around my feet, enough room for my toes, and helped with a mid foot to forefoot stride. The style takes a while to get used to and not for everyone but I would likely buy another pair of these throwbacks for daily use also!
customer_reviews.author: Qflash

customer_reviews.title: My fourth pair!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th pair NB Minimus. They always fit great, and I'm always pleased with them. I wear them both with and without socks. Even though they are the trail version of the shoe, I use them for both trail and city running.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoes I've even owned. I have gone through at least 5 pairs of minimus and I've enjoy each pair.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Rusn tight, order up .5
customer_reviews.text: these run narrow and small. I have had NB minimus before and for some reason these are a totally different fit. love the shoe so going to go .5 up in size and also the next wider width
customer_reviews.author: Eddie B

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but no 4E
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these as my foot is too wide - I am a 4E so I tried to go up a size and squeeze into a 2E. Didn't work. It seems that the New Balance Minumus line has deserted the 4E crowd (they used to offer a 4E) - In fairness, they are not alone, and not the worst. Most other running shoe companies offer only medium width for their minimalist footware. So for now, back to Five Fingers. Still a good looking and feeling shoe, thus the 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Russell E. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Way smaller than the norm, but happy with the shoe.... finally
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is exactly what I wanted, the second time I ordered. I strongly suggest ordering 1 1/2 size larger than your normal shoe size. Nice that NB offers wide athletic shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Catdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes want to make your feet happy. My feet have rarely felt so good without being barefoot on soft grass.
customer_reviews.author: Rambles

customer_reviews.title: then shoe tread will be long-lived and you'll be a happy hiker. Otherwise
customer_reviews.text: If you've got the discipline to restrict use of this shoe to dirt and trail, then shoe tread will be long-lived and you'll be a happy hiker. Otherwise, you'll love this shoe's comfort and performance and be disappointed with the celerity with which the tread wears down.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Went with 1/2 size larger than my prior New Balance shoe purchases, per other customer recommendations.
customer_reviews.author: RN

customer_reviews.title: poor quality, limited life
customer_reviews.text: they didn't last more than 100 miles of trail running. I would not buy them again
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sneaks!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10, ordered a 10.5. Fits perfectly. Awesome shoe....very little padding, but very flexible and form fitting.
customer_reviews.author: D. Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Good sneakers but run a bit small
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes, which I use for trail running but they don’t fit correctly. Every pair of sneakers, boots, shoes I’ve ever bought have been a 9 1/2, these are the only ones that don’t fit properly. I’m hoping to be able to return them for a size 10. I will update this review if I get any help.
customer_reviews.author: H.R. Gieger

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for running!
customer_reviews.text: I used to run in Nike running shoes but I would always get leg cramps, but after switching to these shoes I stop getting leg cramps.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kwon

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: seems nice, but it didn't fit due to smaler than average sizing
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Vereza

customer_reviews.title: because the shoe looks great otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many pairs of NB minimus in the past, but these fit strangely. First of all, I was thrilled to see they brought back the first generation of minimus trail runners. Unfortunately the "band" across the top front of the shoe is tight. Never had this problem before with any other pairs - and I don't have wide feet. I'll keep these as gym shoes, but they're probably not suitable for running. I hope the band loosens over time, because the shoe looks great otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: bpf73

customer_reviews.title: I love, love
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love, this shoes! They fit narrow so consider choosing the same size you wear but in a wide width.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan H.

customer_reviews.title: Happy Feet 😊
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are just as good if not better fitting than the Merrell shoes. If you need to wear a sock, wear the thin "no show" socks. Just a tad snug at first but after a full day of wearing them, the material will relax. Well done New Balance!!! 👍
customer_reviews.author: Gordon M. Mabie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. It's comfy and helped improve my posture when walking
customer_reviews.author: k_han

customer_reviews.title: Thank you New Balance for bringing this version of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Thank you New Balance for bringing this version of the shoe back. I owned 2 pairs of v1(2012) and 4 pairs of v2(2013-2014), I had to return the v3 when I bought it because it was a completely different shoe. I was discouraged when I saw the direction they went with for v4. A re-release of v1 was a refreshing relief! I wear them walking all over campus and I went ahead and grabbed a second pair since my previous stash are showing signs of age after so many years. I now wear those walking around the gym or the house.
customer_reviews.author: Rami  Dass

customer_reviews.title: I'm a fan
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe, wear it every day now. I'm a 10.5 and an 11 gives me perfect room
customer_reviews.author: stephan weaver

customer_reviews.title: Very Narrow
customer_reviews.text: Love to return to the original look, but the execution doesn't match the original Minimus Trail. Far too narrow. Even the wide model I purchased was too narrow, and I don't wear wide shoes. If they would just fix the mid-sole, NB would have an outstanding shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Tim K

customer_reviews.title: Seems great
customer_reviews.text: The shoe ran a half size too small, like a lot of reviewers stated. Nice snug fit, lightweight, and great mobility, I think I found a new favorite shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Slamm3r

customer_reviews.title: Good looks, run small
customer_reviews.text: I think these are designed to be worn without socks, and even barefoot they are at least a half size too small. They do look nice!
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Texas

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are perfect for cross training such as HIIT or crossfit
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are perfect for cross training such as HIIT or crossfit. They are not designed to provide arch support, thus you might get sore arches if you have never done 'barefoot running'.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Favorite shoe
customer_reviews.text: My favorite shoe for standing all day. It is supposed to fit snug (like a glove). That's what gives your foot the arch support. It sounds weird but it is true. This is my 5th pair. My 4th pair (same size) wasn't as snug and it didn't provide the same sort of support.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Regular size shoe is too narrow, so buy wide and big. Great shoe otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews have said this, so I'm just confirming what they've said. My feet are not wide, but the regular size is too narrow. I bought from Zappos my first "wide" shoe (EE); I normally wear a 13, but it took a 14 EE to fit me.
customer_reviews.author: SKS

customer_reviews.title: Terrific shoes as expected - love them. Just one minor problem...
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are great. Fits snug and very comfortable. Performing well. What I was hoping for. One problem - one of the shoe laces arrived partially cut, almost half way through. It still works but annoying to get these terrific shoes with that flaw. Looks like it will hold awhile, but would like to get it replaced so it looks better.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Larson

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe. Run small
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe. Run small. Very limited coushion, which unknown is the point of a minimalist shoe. I prefer them for wearing tonwork or casual than actual exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Excellent CrossFit shoes
customer_reviews.text: I used these for CrossFit and they've been great. They're super comfortable and you get a great feel for the ground. I tried the MX40V1s but sent them back - they were far too padded on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Bob

customer_reviews.title: I've owned several pairs of New Balance, and, ...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several pairs of New Balance, and, sadly, it seems the quality is going down. They are definitely lightweight running shoes, but lightweight to the point of being flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: jadefalcon

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Just make sure to go up half a size. I have wide feet and usually wear a 9.5, but a 10 in these shoes fit me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Bees knees
customer_reviews.text: COMFORTABLE. I wanna wear them everywhere. They're awesome. My feet feel like Spider-Man. My feet are much cooler than the rest of me with these shoes on. These shoes are the bees knees if knees were shoes on bees that were awesome. ...I have spoken.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: This shoe is poorly designed and constructed and doesn't fit ...
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is poorly designed and constructed and doesn't fit right - It is far too narrow for the EE wide designation. It's certainly way too overpriced for the quality of the finished product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes!!! These fit like the original Minimus (still have them). New Balance nails the head on the minimalist shoes.
customer_reviews.author: rksezate

customer_reviews.title: Great Looking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great Look and fit. Bought a few different colors after.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy & Gina

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a well-made shoe, but I ordered a wide pair for my wide feet and these shoes didn’t seem wide at all, far too narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Brockett

customer_reviews.title: Better than Nike Metcon3
customer_reviews.text: I hope these shoes stay in production for a very long time. I purchased 2 different colors. And will continue to purchase as long as they are available. I do crossfit and they made double unders 500x easier than Nike metcon3
customer_reviews.author: Moni

customer_reviews.title: Believe the reviewers that this shoe runs small. Even ...
customer_reviews.text: Believe the reviewers that this shoe runs small. Even the width runs small. Order at least a 1/2 size up. Update: Even a 1/2 size up was still two small. Exchanging for another 1/2 size up. I have never had this issue with other New Balance shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Definitely go up a Full Size. Maybe 1.5 sizes in US measuring. Extraordinary comfort, especially with no socks.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Patton

customer_reviews.title: My first minimalist shoes
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the first pair since it was not wide enough. Even the wider size was slightly uncomfortable for me in the beginning and with socks on. Other than that it feels great and very light. Definitely recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Javad S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My favorite minimalist shoe is back and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excelent trail shoe! Very comfortable! new Balance is the king of minimalist shoe for me!
customer_reviews.author: p. Cahill

customer_reviews.title: Great sneakers. Just be careful with size
customer_reviews.text: Great sneakers. Just be careful with size. The run narrow and small almost a full size. Otherwise great light and cool
customer_reviews.author: A. Agnelli

customer_reviews.title: Fit great, I mean really great but I can see ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit great, I mean really great but I can see they won’t last long. The stitching on the sides of the tongue is extremely weak. NB should have reinforced those ares with extra stitching or something. But I still really like them!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe but uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat disappointed with these shoes. They looked great but the shoe has a band that runs across the front which made the fit uncomfortable. I am returning them and trying out the Merrill Glove 4.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L. Lugo

customer_reviews.title: and they fit much much better. If the shoe feels constricted
customer_reviews.text: I had 10.5 D(M) v3s and tried the same size in the v1s, but they were too tight. I ordered size 11 2E, and they fit much much better. If the shoe feels constricted, I recommend trying the wider version. It is not that much wider than regular, but it makes all the difference for me. I like the way these look better than the v3s, but as far as comfort goes, I put the v3 a notch above. Still very good shoes in the right size.
customer_reviews.author: hadi burpee

customer_reviews.title: great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of these already that I run in all the time and it was time for a new pair, I love these shoes they last a long time and are lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Perfect running shoes...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe... so glad they started making them again. Love the color and the fit is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Spitzhacke33

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking shoe with multiple fit problems
customer_reviews.text: These were too small by a full size. I went through three different exchanges including a wide width (which I never need) before I found shoe size that was somewhat comfortable. And even then there was an issue with the compression strap over the right shoe ( interestingly it was always on the right shoe no matter what size) that pressed down too snugly on top of my foot to the point where it was uncomfortable. Then the back of the left shoe rubbed my Achilles area so badly the bled. Needless to say, I sent them back as defective. Being a Prime Member, that part at least went smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Triumph 1966

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's MT10V1 Minimus Trail Running Shoe
product_meta.description:
Attack the trails with all of the extra tools but none of the extra weight in the minimus trail 10v1. We've brought back the favorite fit and feel of the original model, for unparalleled off-road performance. The new upper material allows for a fresh look at the trail 10, while maintaining the essential forefoot toe splay, and midfoot wrap to hold the foot steady through even the most extreme adventures. Underfoot, the Vibram outsole continues with strategically-placed flex grooves to allow for a natural rúh

New Balance, is dedicated to helping athletes achieve their goals. It's been their mission for more than a century. It's why they don't spend money on celebrity endorsements. They spend it on research and development. It's why they don't design products to fit an image. They design them to fit. New Balance is driven to make the finest shoes for the same reason athletes lace them up: to achieve the very best.
feature_bullets: 4 mm drop - due to variances created during the development and manufacturing processes, all references to 4 mm drop are approximate
